User Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; U; Edition United States Local; en) Presto/2.9.168 Version/11.51

Steps to reproduce:

Tried to set attribute noinitialfocus="true" on a widget inside a tab, such as in this excerpt:
	<vbox>
		<hbox>
		 <description flex="1">Blah blah
		  <html:a href="http://www.mozilla.com/" id="specialLink"
			 noinitialfocus="true">special blah</html:a>.</description>
		</hbox>
	</vbox>



Actual results:

noinitialfocus="true" is honored when the dialog box starts up--the focus is set to the following element. However, when switching between tabs, the focus is set to this element when returning to this tab.


Expected results:

noinitialfocus="true" should be honored on tab changes.

Compare dialog.xml line 158-173 (postLoadInit and focusInit) with tabbox.xml lines 773 and 476 (setTab and _selectNewTab). The line numbers are given for Firefox 8 (mozilla-beta).

See also the documentation at https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XUL/Attribute/noinitialfocus

Basically, it seems that the loop in _selectNewTab should be harmonized with the loop in focusInit so that it looks for the noinitialfocus attribute.
